▬ ABOUT ERIK  ▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran, options trader, and investor. I started trading in 2007 and have spent over 30,000 hours honing my skillset. Like many, I came from a single mom who struggled - yet I became a multi-millionaire in my early 30s.

I’ve no secret tricks or "easy money" strategies. I carefully studied, planned, tracked results, and optimized my performance - and I openly share my journey. 

I built the Outlier Community to connect you with other driven people who are disinterested in average and focused on creating their optimal futures. It's a holistic community, centered on creating financial freedom and living a fulfilling life. From investing basics, options trading, stock market analysis, portfolio management to real estate investing, wealth development, psychology, discipline, fitness, etc. None of us find success solely on our own - here we create it together. Welcome to the Outliers!

I am not a financial advisor. All content is shared for educational and entertainment purposes only.
text: Money cannot buy you happiness, poverty can't buy you anything. That's really the path for most traders is unsuccessful production of capital, meaning we're actually losing money. If you think about creating wealth in terms of a broader plan, there are a handful of really important concepts that I'm going to share with you, three of them to be specific. And these are the exact things that I've used coming from a single mom in a low income area to being a multi-millionaire before I'm 32. And that's not some sort of big flex. I am a Neanderthal just like most other traders. The point I'm trying to highlight here is that it is entirely possible to find your way into a different trajectory if you are thoughtful about what you do. What's up everybody? Eric here will come back to all the outliers, shout out to the YouTube members and the Patreon fam. Thank you guys for supporting the channel and let's get right into it. The very first thing that you are going to see here are some things that you're not going to want to hear and it's whatever it is what it is. The very first thing, the 5,000 account, the 10,000 account that you start with is not going to be your future wealth. So this idea of starting with a small amount of money and trading it into a huge amount of money just sets you up or failure to the highest probability. Do

text: There's a reason why those don't dominate the marketplace yet because as soon as we can do that, everybody will do it. Even though there are small subsets of people that can make a lot of money trading realistically. So we got to make sure that we are guarding against skill gap and making sure that our growth rate makes sense for our skill set. The head and the sand approach is super common. It's when traders they don't want to have a trading plan. They don't want to be held accountable for what they're doing. They don't want to be responsible for the outcomes. They want to be able to blame things so they don't have a trading log. And essentially we just go in circles because our ego prevents us from making good decisions and making sure that we're controlling things. The problem with this is you're not going to gain any traction. If you do not have a trading plan and if you do not have a trading log that is documenting your capacity and your success in paper trading, you are putting your head in the sand. You're just hoping that you're going to figure out on the fly because you do better under pressure or you perform better when you have skin in the game.
